On Feb 17, 2005, at 8:33 AM, Chris Dollin wrote:

>
> On Thursday 17 February 2005 15:18, Mike Clark wrote:
>> I like how you think, Todd.  :-)
>>
>> I don't know the history behind the design decision to use static
>> methods in Assert, but I'd love to know.
>
> My *guess* would be that this allows them to be used without
> having to inherit from, or have to hand an instance of,
> Assert.
>
> Like, you want to put a JUnit-style assertion in a piece of code
> that already exists.

Yep, it does buy you not having to create an instance of Assert to call 
an assertion method from a class that doesn't inherit from TestCase.  
And, well, it prevents you from altering the DNA of JUnit by overriding 
the built-in assertions to do something fundamentally different.  And 
maybe the decision was as easy as that...

Mike
